Method Detail

abbreviate

public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                                          int maxLength)
Abbreviates a string using ellipses.

Leading and trailing whitespace are ignored.

When abbreviating a string, this method will try to leave a whitespace between the last non trimmed word and the ellipses if there is enough space.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate (if needed)
maxLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated string (but length of ellipses is taking account when we need to abbreviate it)
Returns:
Same string if its length is less or equal than maxLength or abbreviated string otherwise

abbreviate

public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                                          int maxLength,
                                          boolean trim)
Abbreviates a string using ellipses.

When abbreviating a string, this method will try to leave a whitespace between the last non trimmed word and the ellipses if there is enough space.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate (if needed)
maxLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated string (but length of ellipses is taking account when we need to abbreviate it)
trim - Flag to indicate if we want to omit leading and trailing whitespaces (true) or not (false)
Returns:
Same string if its length is less or equal than maxLength or abbreviated string otherwise

abbreviate

public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                                          int maxLength,
                                          boolean trim,
                                          java.lang.String appendToEnd)
Abbreviates a string.

When abbreviating a string, this method will try to leave a whitespace between the last non trimmed word and the string to append at the end if there is enough space.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate (if needed)
maxLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated string (but length of string to append at the end is taking account when we need to abbreviate it)
trim - Flag to indicate if we want to omit leading and trailing whitespaces (true) or not (false)
appendToEnd - String to append at the end (if the string needs to be abbreviated)
Returns:
Same string if its length is less or equal than maxLength or abbreviated string otherwise

abbreviate

public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                                          int maxLength,
                                          boolean trim,
                                          java.lang.String appendToEnd,
                                          boolean ignoreWords)
Abbreviates a string.

When abbreviating a string, if we are not ignoring words this method will try to leave a whitespace between the last non trimmed word and the string to append at the end if there is enough space.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate (if needed)
maxLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated string (but length of string to append at the end is taking account when we need to abbreviate it)
trim - Flag to indicate if we want to omit leading and trailing whitespaces (true) or not (false)
appendToEnd - String to append at the end (if the string needs to be abbreviated)
ignoreWords - Flag to indicate if we want to ignore words when abbreviating (true) or not (false)
Returns:
Same string if its length is less or equal than maxLength or abbreviated string otherwise

abbreviate

public static java.lang.String abbreviate(java.lang.String str,
                                          int maxLength,
                                          boolean trim,
                                          java.lang.String appendToEnd,
                                          boolean ignoreWords,
                                          boolean ignoreAppendToEndLength)
Abbreviates a string.

When abbreviating a string, if we are not ignoring words this method will try to leave a whitespace before the string to append at the end if there is enough space.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate (if needed)
maxLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated string (but length of string to append at the end is taking account when we need to abbreviate it if ignoreAppendToEndLength is false)
trim - Flag to indicate if we want to omit leading and trailing whitespaces (true) or not (false)
appendToEnd - String to append at the end (if the string needs to be abbreviated)
ignoreWords - Flag to indicate if we want to ignore words when abbreviating (true) or not (false)
ignoreAppendToEndLength - Flag to indicate if we want to ignore length of string to append at the end when abbreviating (true) or not (false)
Returns:
Same string if its length is less or equal than maxLength or abbreviated string otherwise

abbreviateWords

public static java.lang.String abbreviateWords(java.lang.String str,
                                               int maxWordLength)
Abbreviates words within a string using short ellipses.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate words (if needed)
maxWordLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated words
Returns:
Same string but with large words abbreviated

abbreviateWords

public static java.lang.String abbreviateWords(java.lang.String str,
                                               int maxWordLength,
                                               java.lang.String appendToWordEnd)
Abbreviates words within a string.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate words (if needed)
maxWordLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated words
appendToWordEnd - String to append at the end of word (for the words needing to be abbreviated)
Returns:
Same string but with large words abbreviated

abbreviateWords

public static java.lang.String abbreviateWords(java.lang.String str,
                                               int maxWordLength,
                                               java.lang.String appendToWordEnd,
                                               boolean ignoreAppendToWordEndLength)
Abbreviates words within a string.

Parameters:
str - String to abbreviate words (if needed)
maxWordLength - Maximum length of the abbreviated words (but length of string to append at the end of words is taking account when we need to abbreviate it if ignoreAppendToWordEndLength is false)
appendToWordEnd - String to append at the end of word (for the words needing to be abbreviated)
ignoreAppendToWordEndLength - Flag to indicate if we want to ignore length of string to append at the end of words when abbreviating (true) or not (false)
Returns:
Same string but with large words abbreviated

hasUnexpectedCharacters

public static boolean hasUnexpectedCharacters(java.lang.String str,
                                              boolean includeLetters,
                                              boolean includeDigits,
                                              boolean includeWhitespaces,
                                              char[] otherExpectedCharacters)
Parameters:
str - String
includeLetters - true if string is expected to include letters, false if not
includeDigits - true if string is expected to include digits, false if not
includeWhitespaces - true if string is expected to include whitespaces, false if not
otherExpectedCharacters - Array with other characters expected to be found within string
Returns:
true if string has at least an unexpected character, false otherwise

Parameters:
str - String
Returns:
